title: Coffee
steps: Boil 1 cup of water in a kettle.
Add 1-2 teaspoons of coffee powder to a cup.
Pour hot water into the cup over the coffee powder.
Stir well until the coffee powder dissolves.
Add sugar and milk to taste, stir again.
description: A simple yet refreshing cup of coffee to kickstart your day.

title: Sandwich
steps: Take 2 slices of bread and spread butter on one side of each slice.
Layer lettuce leaves, sliced tomatoes, cucumber, and cheese on one slice.
Place the other slice of bread on top, butter side down.
Press gently and cut the sandwich diagonally.
description: A quick and easy vegetable sandwich for a light meal.

title: Pan Cake
steps: In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of flour, 2 tablespoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of baking powder.
Gradually add 1 cup of milk while whisking to form a smooth batter.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and grease lightly with butter.
Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
description: Fluffy pancakes perfect for a hearty breakfast.

title: Soya Chaap with Gravy
steps: Soak 6-8 soya chaap sticks in water for 30 minutes, then drain and cut into pieces.
Marinate the soya chaap pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala for 1 hour.
In a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons of oil and sauté thinly sliced onions until golden brown.
Add 2 chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.
Add the marinated soya chaap to the pan and cook until the chaap is well-coated with the masala.
Add 1 cup of water and simmer the gravy on low heat for 15-20 minutes until the soya chaap is tender and the gravy thickens.
Garnish with fresh cream and chopped coriander leaves before serving hot.
description: A rich and creamy dish featuring tender soya chaap pieces cooked in a flavorful gravy.

title: Vegetable Kebabs
steps: Cut 1 large potato, 1 large carrot, and 1 large bell pepper into cubes.
In a bowl, mix 2 tablespoons of yogurt, 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon of red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Marinate the vegetable cubes in the mixture for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Thread the marinated vegetable cubes onto skewers.
Grill the kebabs on medium heat for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally until cooked through and lightly charred.
description: Flavorful and colorful vegetable kebabs made from marinated vegetables.

title: Veggie Burger
steps: Boil and mash 2 medium potatoes.
In a bowl, mix the mashed potatoes with 1/2 cup of finely chopped carrots, 1/2 cup of green peas, 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Shape the mixture into patties and coat them with breadcrumbs.
Shallow fry the vegetable patties in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
Slice burger buns in half and toast lightly.
Spread mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard sauce on the toasted buns.
Layer with lettuce leaves, tomato slices, and the fried vegetable patties.
Cover with the top half of the bun and serve hot with fries.
description: A crispy and flavorful veggie burger, perfect for a delicious and hearty meal.

title: Chole Paneer
steps: Heat oil in a pot and fry 1 finely chopped onion until golden brown.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add 1 chopped tomato and cook until it becomes soft and mushy.
Stir in 2 teaspoons of red chili powder, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of cumin powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Add 1 cup of cooked chickpeas (chole) and mix well.
Add 200g of cubed paneer and gently mix it with the chickpeas.
Add 1/2 cup of water and cook on low heat until the gravy thickens and the paneer absorbs the flavors.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot.
description: A delicious and hearty curry made with chickpea and Paneer.

title: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch 250g of spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain and puree.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and sauté 1 chopped onion until translucent.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add 1 chopped tomato, 1 teaspoon of cumin powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste. Cook until the tomato is soft.
Add the spinach puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in 200g of cubed paneer and cook for another 5 minutes.
description: A creamy and nutritious dish made with spinach and paneer.

title: Chana Masala
steps: Soak 1 cup of chickpeas overnight, then drain and cook in 3 cups of water until tender.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and sauté 1 chopped onion until golden brown.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add 1 chopped tomato, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of coriander powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Cook until the tomato is soft, then add the cooked chickpeas and 1 cup of water.
Simmer for 15 minutes, then garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
description: A spicy and tangy chickpea curry that is perfect with rice or roti.

title: Russian Vegetable Salad
steps: Boil 2 medium potatoes, 2 medium carrots, and 1 cup of peas until tender. Let them cool.
Peel and dice the boiled potatoes and carrots.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced potatoes, carrots, peas, 1/2 cup of diced pickles, and 1/2 cup of boiled and diced beets.
Add 1/2 cup of diced apples and 1/2 cup of finely chopped onions.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and add 1 tablespoon of olive oil.
Gently mix all the ingredients together until well combined.
Garnish with chopped dill or parsley before serving.
description: A traditional Russian salad made with a variety of boiled vegetables, perfect as a side dish.

title: French Fries
steps: Peel and cut 3 large potatoes into thin strips.
Soak the potato strips in cold water for 30 minutes to remove excess starch.
Drain the potatoes and pat them dry with a kitchen towel.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the potatoes in batches for 4-5 minutes until they are soft but not browned. Remove and drain on paper towels.
Increase the oil temperature to 375°F (190°C).
Fry the potatoes again in batches for 2-3 minutes until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from oil, drain on paper towels, and immediately season with salt.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.
description: Crispy and golden French fries, perfect as a snack or side dish.

title: Gulab Jamun
steps: In a bowl, mix 1 cup of milk powder, 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour, 1/4 teaspoon of baking soda, and 2 tablespoons of ghee.
Add milk gradually to form a soft dough.
Make small balls from the dough and deep fry in hot oil until golden brown.
In another pot, heat 1 cup of sugar and 1 cup of water until the sugar dissolves and the syrup thickens slightly.
Soak the fried balls in the sugar syrup for at least 30 minutes before serving.
description: A traditional Indian dessert made from deep-fried dough balls soaked in sweet syrup.

title: Daal Makhni & Naan
steps: Soak 1 cup of whole black lentils (urad dal) and 1/4 cup of red kidney beans (rajma) overnight.
In a large pot, cook the soaked lentils and beans with 4 cups of water, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, and salt to taste until they are soft and tender.
Heat butter in a pan, add 1 finely chopped onion, and sauté until golden brown.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 teaspoon of red chili powder, and 1 teaspoon of cumin powder. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and the masala is well-cooked.
Add the cooked lentils and beans to the pan, mix well, and simmer on low heat for 1-2 hours. Add cream and butter as needed to achieve a rich, creamy consistency.
Garnish with fresh cream and chopped coriander leaves before serving.
For Naan: Mix 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of yogurt, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and a pinch of salt to form a dough. Let it rest for 1-2 hours.
Divide the dough into small balls, roll them out, and cook on a hot griddle until golden brown. Brush with butter and serve hot with Daal Makhni.
description: A creamy and flavorful lentil dish, Daal Makhni is a classic North Indian recipe often paired with soft, fluffy Naan.

title: Aloo Paratha
steps: Boil and mash 2 large potatoes.
Add 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped green chili, 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste to the mashed potatoes. Mix well.
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into a small circle.
Place a spoonful of the potato mixture in the center of the dough circle and fold the edges to seal.
Roll the filled dough ball into a larger circle, being careful not to let the filling spill out.
Heat a tawa or skillet over medium heat and cook the paratha on both sides until golden brown, applying ghee or oil as needed.
description: A traditional Pakistani flatbread stuffed with a spiced potato filling.

title: Chole Bhature
steps: Soak 1 cup of chickpeas (chole) in water overnight, then drain and cook them in a pressure cooker with 4 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of salt until they are soft.
Heat oil in a pot and fry 1 finely chopped onion until golden brown.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add 1 chopped tomato and cook until it becomes soft and mushy.
Stir in 2 teaspoons of red chili powder, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of cumin powder, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, and salt to taste.
Add the cooked chickpeas to the pot and mix well.
Add 1 cup of water and cook on low heat until the gravy thickens and the chickpeas absorb the flavors.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with bhature.
For Bhature: Knead a dough using 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of yogurt, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Let it rest for 1-2 hours.
Divide the dough into small balls, roll them out into circles, and deep fry in hot oil until they puff up and turn golden brown.
Serve the bhature hot with the prepared chole.
description: A popular North Indian dish consisting of spicy chickpeas (chole) served with deep-fried bread (bhature). A hearty and flavorful meal, often enjoyed for breakfast or lunch.

title: Masala Dosa
steps: Soak 1 cup of rice and 1/2 cup of urad dal (split black gram) separately in water for 4-6 hours.
Grind the soaked rice and dal separately to a smooth batter, then mix them together with salt to taste. Let the batter ferment overnight.
For the masala filling, heat oil in a pan and fry 1 finely chopped onion until translucent.
Add 1 tablespoon of ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add 2 boiled and mashed potatoes, 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon of mustard seeds, and salt to taste. Mix well and cook for a few minutes.
Heat a non-stick pan or griddle and spread a ladleful of the dosa batter in a thin, even layer.
Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden and crispy.
Place a portion of the potato masala in the center of the dosa, fold it, and serve hot with chutney and sambar.
description: A popular South Indian dish, Masala Dosa is a crispy rice crepe filled with a spicy potato mixture, served with chutney and sambar.
